CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The CV curves were recorded referenced to an Ag / Ag þ electrode , which was calibrated against the ferroceneferrocenium ( Fc / Fc þ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ) ; the CV curves are shown in Figure 3.

Let's think step by step.

1. Ag / Ag þ (Silver/Silver ion)
2. Ferroceneferrocenium (Fc / Fc þ) (Ferrocene/Ferrocenium ion)
3. Vacuum level (not a material, but a physical concept)
4. Ag (Silver)
5. Fc (Ferrocene)

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are Ag, Ag þ, Fc, and Fc þ.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

The CV curves were recorded referenced to an Ag electrode, calibrated against the Fc/Fc þ redox couple; the CV curves are shown in Figure 3.

Material Name entities:
1. Ag
2. Fc
3. Fc þ

So, the only relevant Material Name entities in the paragraph are Ag, Fc, and Fc þ.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Ag |
| Fc |
| Fc þ |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The CV curves were recorded referenced to an Ag / Ag þ electrode , which was calibrated against the ferroceneferrocenium ( Fc / Fc þ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ) ; the CV curves are shown in Figure 3.

Let's think step by step.

1. Ag / Ag þ electrode: This is a type of electrode, specifically an Ag (silver) electrode with an Ag+/Ag redox couple (Ag þ/Ag).
2. Fc / Fc þ redox couple: This is a redox couple, specifically the ferrocene/ferrocenium redox couple (Fc/Fc þ).
3. 4.8 eV: This is a property representing energy in electron volts (eV).
4. Vacuum level: This is a property, specifically the energy level of electrons in a vacuum.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.
1. 4.8 eV: This is a material property representing energy in electron volts (eV).

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The CV curves were recorded referenced to an Ag / Ag þ electrode , which was calibrated against the ferroceneferrocenium ( Fc / Fc þ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ) ; the CV curves are shown in Figure 3.

Let's think step by step.

1. Ag / Ag þ electrode: This is a type of electrode, specifically a silver/silver ion electrode. The property value here is the electrode itself.
2. 4.8 eV: This is an energy value, specifically the redox potential of the ferroceneferrocenium (Fc / Fc þ) redox couple, which is 4.8 eV below the vacuum level.
3. Figure 3: This is a visual representation or property value, specifically a graph or chart that shows the CV curves mentioned in the text.
4. Vacuum level: This is a reference level or property value, specifically the energy level in a vacuum. In this context, it is used as a reference point to determine the redox potential of the Fc / Fc þ redox couple.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. 4.8 eV: This is the value of the energy property of the Fc / Fc þ redox couple.
2. Vacuum level: This is the value of the energy property level in a vacuum.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 4.8 eV (redox potential of Fc / Fc þ redox couple) |
| Vacuum level (energy level in a vacuum) |
